homePage.ourVision:
We all have one big goal. We want to become the largest non-profit donation platform of this new generation. We can only do this thanks to your help and through interesting partner programmes of companies with the biggest online shops. In the past few years, the turnover of these companies has risen continuously and most recently amounted to around 86.7 billion euros.

The 100 online shops with the highest turnover in Germany had a turnover of around 58 billion euros in 2021. Only together are we strong? In a nutshell, we will make life more liveable for many. To achieve this, it only takes 2 simple steps. You can find them under "Do good now". From now on, you too can be the reason why someone smiles, and not just today.

QA.title: What is a non-profit UG?
QA.content: The gUG pursues a charitable, benevolent or ecclesiastical corporate purpose. In the case of the gUG, 75 per cent of the profits must benefit the charitable purpose. The other 25 per cent is used to build up the share capital in order to convert the gUG into a non-profit GmbH.

QA.title: Can I also donate money to you?
QA.content: No. We do not accept donations of any kind. We work mainly through referral commissions from affiliate programs. If you would like to donate money, please contact our partner Betterplace.org.

QA.title: What are affiliate programmes?
QA.content: Partner programmes/affiliate systems are based on the principle of referral commission. The technical basis in the virtual world of the World Wide Web is the affiliate link. This contains a special code that uniquely identifies the affiliate, i.e. our We Show Heart Community, with the merchant. If a user now visits our app or website, he or she will be made aware of various affiliate programmes of many interesting companies. If you now click on the link of one of these providers, you will be redirected to the corresponding online shop. If you then make a purchase in the online shop, this purchase is added to our We Show Heart Community and we receive a small referral commission. But only if a transaction has actually taken place.

QA.title: Are there any partner programs for different countries
QA.content: Unfortunately, yes. One company can set up a partner program for several countries or only for a single country. Therefore, if someone from Switzerland orders something, he can only do so under the partner program of his home country, provided that there is a partner program there. If someone from Switzerland orders something from an affiliate program in Germany, there will be no referral commission and no money we can donate. If you order online, please click on your home country in advance. An exception applies to partner programs worldwide. For these orders, it does not matter from which home country you come.

QA.title: Do some companies refuse to cooperate
QA.content:
Unfortunately, yes. Although we are a non-profit organization. But it is not only companies that refuse us. Many companies have their partner program managed by an agency. The reasons for the rejections are as follows. 
1. website does not complement the brand of the company
2. company does not work with this type
3. URL is not relevant to the company
4. we are very choosy about cooperation
5. we are only interested in companies with high sales figures
Here at our company we are concerned with children in poverty, animals in need and other important aid projects. For us, these reasons are incomprehensible and an absolute indictment.

QA.title: Are there any additional costs for my orders?
QA.content: No. You can check this at any time with all partner programmes. First, simply click on the desired link of an affiliate programme in our app or on our website, www.wirzeigenherz.eu. Next, simply search for the desired product and note the purchase price. Then open another browser and search Google for this online shop and the same product. Now compare the two purchase prices and you will see that there is no difference.

QA.title: How can I order online now?
QA.content: Please only use the links from our partner programmes if you order online. You will only find these in our mobile app and website, www.wirzeigenherz.eu. This is the only way to generate income from donations.

QA.title: Can you see my orders?
QA.content: No. We only get the info about the amount of referral commissions.

QA.title: Do I have to enter data to order?
QA.content: No. You just click on the link of the desired online store. After that you will be redirected to the website of the desired online store. With us you do not have to register, let alone enter any access data.

QA.title: Do you have to pay tax on the income generated?
QA.content: No. As a non-profit organisation, we do not have to pay taxes on the income. This allows us to invest the entire income minus the costs in the donation projects.

QA.title: Do the donation projects also receive your money?
QA.content: Yes. Otherwise, we would lose our status as a non-profit organisation. Furthermore, we would also have to pay back all tax relief retroactively.

QA.title: How do the donation projects receive your money?
QA.content: Currently we use donation projects that are posted on the Betterplace.org donation platform. Betterplace.org is a donation platform from Berlin, founded in 2007 and operated by the non-profit corporation gut.org. After voting, the income is paid out to the various donation projects on a percentage basis. In the future, we will certainly consider our own donation projects.

QA.title: Who is Betterplace.org
QA.content: Betterplace.org is Germany's largest donation platform. One hundred twenty corporate partners have been doing good for 14 years. As of today, Betterplace.org has launched 47,262 projects in 185 countries and collected approximately â‚¬198 million in donations. Betterplace.org is a non-profit and does not work for a profit. Transparency is one of the basic ideas of Betterplace.org. Therefore, all social projects that collect donations through Betterplace.org are encouraged to tell the community how these donations are used.

projects.description:
As a non-profit organization, breakfast4kids e. V. has set itself the goal of providing as many children as possible with a healthy packed lunch every day. After we started in early 2009 with the first school in a pilot project (12 snacks daily) and were able to gain experience, our concept is currently accepted by 33 schools / daycare centers in the cities of Aachen, Alsdorf, BrÃ¼hl, Eschweiler, Herzogenrath, Cologne and Stolberg. We supply around 1,100 children here every day. 
 
Early in the morning, long before school starts, several hundred break sandwiches are cut, greased, lovingly topped, hygienically packed and delivered to the elementary schools / daycare centers by other helpers before classes begin. There, the break sandwiches are distributed to the schools / daycare centers, to the individual classes under their own direction. This ensures that all children can have breakfast at break time. 
 
The demand is reported by the school management to the association, which provides and delivers the corresponding sandwiches free of charge. The helpers do not find out who in the class receives a breakfast4kids sandwich, because no child should feel excluded. The positive side effect of not being hungry is that the children can concentrate better, are more active and communicative, and also learn to share. 
 
A small snack with a big effect. A hearty breakfast is the perfect start to the day. Above all, it gives children the necessary strength and energy to master the challenges of the school day. With a good breakfast and a full belly, they "simply feel better," are more concentrated at work and perform better. However, more and more schools are reporting that many of their students often come to school without breakfast. 
 
Facts: 
 
Children not bringing breakfast to school or daycare can have a variety of causes. Some children are left on their own in the morning, guardians don't have time or there is simply a lack of money. 
 
Our goal: 
 
Our goal is to feed as many children as possible with a healthy breakfast in the schools. With your help, we can currently guarantee over 1,100 children a snack for at least 1 school year. If necessary, we would like to reach even more children and provide them with a healthy snack.
projects.title: A packed lunch for every child
projects.organisation: A project from breakfast4kids e.V. in Aachen, Cologne, Germany

projects.description:
On February 6, 2023, two devastating earthquakes struck Turkey and the border region.

As a result, tens of thousands of people lost their lives in both countries, and many more sustained life-threatening injuries. Thousands of buildings have collapsed and people are in urgent need of safe shelter and humanitarian aid.

CARE is on the ground providing those affected with tents, mattresses and tarpaulins, to build temporary emergency shelters. The most urgently needed items include: Food, water, blankets and health items. CARE is distributing emergency relief packages containing items of daily use such as soap, toothbrushes/paste, underwear, towels, cooking pots, dishes, water purification tablets and jerry cans.

CARE aid workers:in place a special emphasis on meeting the needs of women and girls because they are often disproportionately affected by disasters. Approximately 37,000 pregnant women are due to give birth soon and 5,000 women require emergency obstetric care. CARE teams provide sexual and reproductive health services to pregnant women and expectant mothers and support victims of sexual violence. They also provide safe shelters and deliver much-needed water, sanitation and hygiene services to prevent the outbreak of diseases such as cholera.

Your help is urgently needed! Donate now!

We'll keep you updated on our work here:
Instagram, Facebook, YouTube & on our website.
projects.title: CARE emergency aid after earthquake
projects.organisation: A project of CARE Germany e.V. in Gaziantep, Turkey

projects.description:
Today Tina is 14 years old. Her fight against blood cancer lasted 6 years. During this time, fear and the question of how to continue prevailed. With every treatment, she was afraid that her values would continue to deteriorate. Until the redeeming news: her genetic twin had finally been found. Tina's stem cell donor is now 25 years old and an important person in her life.

With over 11 million registered stem cell donors, DKMS is the world's largest file in the fight against blood cancer. But still every 10th affected person does not find a suitable stem cell donor. 

The goal of the DKMS is to make this life-saving donation possible for all blood cancer patients who are in need of a stem cell transplant. Help us!

Unexpectedly, every 12 minutes a person in Germany receives the devastating diagnosis of blood cancer. Whether child or adult, no one is safe from this disease. Many patients can only hope for a suitable stem cell donation.

Every day, people willing to help register with the DKMS. In the fight against blood cancer, every donation counts, because the registration of a new donor alone costs DKMS 40 euros. With your donation you support us in registering new donors, give patients worldwide access to therapies and promote research for the best possible treatment of blood cancer patients. You give people like Tina the hope of life.

You can find out how to register as a DKMS donor at dkms.de.
projects.title: Together against blood cancer
projects.organisation: A project of DKMS gemeinnÃ¼tzige GmbH in nationwide, Germany

projects.description:
Be part of it! For the global climate, it does not matter where CO2 emissions are emitted or avoided or reduced. This means: It makes a lot of sense to get involved in climate protection across national borders and to finance the saving and reduction of CO2 elsewhere.

In concrete terms, this means that we often reinvest part of the wealth we have generated. For every euro invested, more greenhouse gases can be saved in emerging or developing countries than would be possible with the same amount in Germany. In addition, we promote prosperity and social participation in these countries in line with the 17 sustainability goals of the UN Agenda 2030. However, the overriding goal must remain local CO2 avoidance - one planet for all, all for one planet.

All of us in Wuppertal should use resources responsibly and avoid unnecessary CO2 emissions. But what can we do in addition? Another option that can be implemented immediately is to promote global climate protection - to the extent of today's unavoidable domestic emissions or even beyond.

Together, we want to and can achieve more: By using our wealth in a targeted way and committing to meaningful, international climate protection projects that need support.

Information about our certified partners can be found here:
Reduce CO2 (sparkasse-wuppertal.de)
projects.title: Improve the climate worldwide
projects.organisation: A project of Community Foundation for Wuppertal, Germany

projects.description:
What is our project about?
More space for culture - also and especially now: We need your support! Create with us a new center for a free, lively and diverse scene in and for Karlsruhe. Support our cultural work with your donation.

Who is behind the project?
For more than ten years, Panorama e.V. has been committed to an open and creative cultural scene in and for Karlsruhe. With projects such as "Halle 14" and "P8", the non-profit association has already supported independent and non-commercial projects and events in the past. Many artists had their first performances there, many people organized their first concerts and exhibitions there. We want to continue this engagement and create a new place, with more space and new possibilities.

What are our goals?
Currently, a large number of cultural areas in Karlsruhe are threatened by demolition and buyout. We want to make a long-term and affordable replacement possible for at least some of those affected. We want to continue to work with many people for a lively and diverse cultural scene. After a long search for a new cultural area, we finally have reason to rejoice: The independent cultural scene is getting a new home in Karlsruhe-Bulach! On almost 3,000 mÂ² of space, we are creating a place for creative ideas and people: with large event spaces, two open-air areas as well as 15 rehearsal rooms, 12 studios and more space for cultural and artistic initiatives in the city.

Why do we need your support?
We want to show that art and music are colorful and diverse, connect people and creativity enriches everyday life. In the coming weeks, we need to expand the existing spaces and create new ones for this purpose. For the new center, this will create well-equipped and affordable spaces for over 150 creative people. Together we are building on the foundation of open cultural access for all and the joint shaping of the local cultural scene. The opportunity is favorable and unfortunately rare: Space for culture has unfortunately often fallen by the wayside due to economic interests. Be part of building a long-term and creative arts and culture center! 

What happens with the money in case of successful support?
We use all donations to create the framework for a new, uncommercial and diverse cultural center to support creatives and cultural workers. To promote access and participation for all, to shape a cultural scene in and for Karlsruhe that is critical of discrimination. Let's create a lively place of culture together!
 
p-eight.org
https://www.facebook.com/p8karlsruhe
https://www.instagram.com/p8_karlsruhe/?hl=de
projects.title: More space for culture
projects.organisation: A project by Panorama e.V. - P8 - Sociocultural Center in Karlsruhe, Germany

projects.description:
With Ralphy's Ranch we are planning an animal sanctuary and a life yard for all animals - because with us there is no speciesism.

We, Stephan PÃ¼tz, Robert Marc Lehmann, Lea Sommer and Mission Erde e.V. are convinced that every animal deserves a life free and without expectations of economic benefit. We live and communicate this attitude to life every day! For us at Mission Erde e.V., animal welfare starts on our own doorstep and doesn't stop at any national border. 
 
At Ralphy's Ranch you will find freed animals from Robert's undercover operations,
abused "useful" animals from the mass livestock farming, street dogs or hard-to-place dogs from domestic and foreign missions and mentally or physically ill creatures a temporary or permanent roof over their heads. Even if we cannot give every animal back its natural habitat (e.g. rescued foxes or chinchillas from fur farms), we can offer them a loving, species-appropriate home at Ralphy's Ranch and above all a life without torture and torment.
 
With "Ralphy's Ranch" social media and film projects, we also pursue the purpose of awakening love and understanding for the animal world through education, good examples and the role model function, in order to sustainably promote the welfare and species-appropriate keeping of animals.
 
Ralphy's Ranch is a project (or long-term mission) of Mission Erde e.V.
 
With the power and support of the Mission Erde & Stephan PÃ¼tz Community, we would like to continue to grow and implement this project. PS: Why do we use betterplace.org for this? Donating here is safe and uncomplicated. Additionally you will be kept informed about updates. Of course you will also receive a donation receipt for tax purposes.
projects.title: Create animal sanctuary
projects.organisation: A project of Mission Erde e.V. in Oberursel, Germany
